member.summary: Returns the byte to use when the character passed across is entered during editing.

member.summary: Returns the character to display for the byte passed across.

member.summary: Returns the byte to use for the character passed across.

member.name: T:Be.Windows.Forms.EbcdicByteCharProvider
member.summary: A byte char provider that can translate bytes encoded in codepage 500 EBCDIC

member.name: F:Be.Windows.Forms.EbcdicByteCharProvider._ebcdicEncoding
member.summary: The IBM EBCDIC code page 500 encoding. Note that this is not always supported by .NET, the underlying platform has to provide support for it.

member.summary: Returns the EBCDIC character corresponding to the byte passed across.

member.summary: Returns the byte corresponding to the EBCDIC character passed across.

member.summary: Returns a description of the byte char provider.

the byte to write

member.summary: Inserts bytes into the provider
member.remarks: This method must raise the LengthChanged event.

member.summary: Deletes bytes from the provider

the length of the bytes to delete
member.remarks: This method must raise the LengthChanged event.

member.summary: True, when changes are done.

member.name: M:Be.Windows.Forms.IByteProvider.ApplyChanges
member.summary: Applies changes.

member.summary: Returns a value if the WriteByte methods is supported by the provider.

member.name: M:Be.Windows.Forms.IByteProvider.SupportsInsertBytes
member.summary: Returns a value if the InsertBytes methods is supported by the provider.
member.returns: True, when it´s supported.

member.name: M:Be.Windows.Forms.IByteProvider.SupportsDeleteBytes
member.summary: Returns a value if the DeleteBytes methods is supported by the provider.
member.returns: True, when it´s supported.

member.summary: Occurs, when bytes are changed.

member.name: M:Be.Windows.Forms.Caret.ValidateCaretPos
member.remarks: If the caret position is outside the document text bounds it is set to the correct position by calling ValidateCaretPos.

member.summary: Defines the type of the Find operation.

member.summary: Used for Text Find operations

member.summary: Used for Hex Find operations

member.summary: Defines all state information nee

member.name: F:Be.Windows.Forms.FindOptions._matchCase
member.summary: Contains the MatchCase value

member.summary: Contains the text that should be found.

member.name: M:Be.Windows.Forms.FindOptions.UpdateFindBuffer
member.summary: Updates the find buffer.

member.name: P:Be.Windows.Forms.FindOptions.IsValid
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the Find options are valid

member.name: P:Be.Windows.Forms.FindOptions.FindBuffer
member.summary: Gets the Find buffer used for case insensitive Find operations. This is the binary representation of Text.

member.name: P:Be.Windows.Forms.FindOptions.FindBufferLowerCase
member.summary: Gets the Find buffer used for case sensitive Find operations. This is the binary representation of Text in lower case format.

member.name: P:Be.Windows.Forms.FindOptions.FindBufferUpperCase
member.summary: Gets the Find buffer used for case sensitive Find operations. This is the binary representation of Text in upper case format.

member.name: P:Be.Windows.Forms.FindOptions.MatchCase
member.summary: Gets or sets the value, whether the Find operation is case sensitive or not.

member.name: P:Be.Windows.Forms.FindOptions.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text that should be found. Only used, when Type is FindType.Hex.

member.name: P:Be.Windows.Forms.FindOptions.Hex
member.summary: Gets or sets the hex buffer that should be found. Only used, when Type is FindType.Hex.

member.name: P:Be.Windows.Forms.FindOptions.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the type what should be searched.

member.name: F:Be.Windows.Forms.Util._designMode
member.summary: Contains true, if we are in design mode of Visual Studio

member.name: M:Be.Windows.Forms.Util.#cctor
member.summary: Initializes an instance of Util class

member.name: P:Be.Windows.Forms.Util.DesignMode
member.summary: Gets true, if we are in design mode of Visual Studio
member.remarks: In Visual Studio 2008 SP1 the designer is crashing sometimes on windows forms. The DesignMode property of Control class is buggy and cannot be used, so use our own implementation instead.

member.summary: Contains string format information for hex values

member.summary: Contains the current key interpreter

member.summary: Contains an empty key interpreter without functionality

member.summary: Contains True if caret is visible

member.summary: Contains true, if the find (Find method) should be aborted.

member.name: F:Be.Windows.Forms.HexBox._findingPos
member.summary: Contains a value of the current finding position.

member.name: F:Be.Windows.Forms.HexBox._insertActive
member.summary: Contains a state value about Insert or Write mode. When this value is true and the ByteProvider SupportsInsert is true bytes are inserted instead of overridden.

member.summary: Return true if Cut method could be invoked.

member.summary: Converts a byte array to a hex string. For example: {10,11} = "0A 0B"

member.returns: the hex string

member.param: the byte to format
member.returns: the hex string

member.name: M:Be.Windows.Forms.HexBox.ConvertHexToBytes(System.String)
member.summary: Converts the hex string to an byte array. The hex string must be separated by a space char ' '. If there is any invalid hex information in the string the result will be null.
member.param: the hex string separated by ' '. For example: "0A 0B 0C"
member.returns: the byte array. null if hex is invalid or empty

member.name: T:Be.Windows.Forms.DynamicFileByteProvider
member.summary: Implements a fully editable byte provider for file data of any size.
member.remarks: Only changes to the file are stored in memory with reads from the original data occurring as required.
